intro: Elaphoglossum subarborescens, commonly known as the tree fern elaphoglossum, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender rhizome and a crown of compound leaves that are typically pinnate. The fronds are usually dark green and can grow to considerable lengths, often reaching several meters in height. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. It plays a role in forest ecosystems by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms and small animals.
